column4: hm, i have a solitary white pixel on my panel which acts like an applet (as in, it gets moved along when moving around applets), but cant be removed or moved by its own
any ideas?
its there in a standard UNR installation
hm, i just realized:
that white pixel is there for everybody it seems, as i can find it on screenshots on the net
what white pixel?
if you right click there it is so that you can move the clock
oh its NBrmx, I never liked netbook remix, too buggy for my liking
yeah i know what you mean, i suggest going to the usual ubuntu until the next ubuntu release, if it annoys you that much
im running an eeepc 1000H right now and the only problem i have is some things go off screen
never looked at them, didnt really see a reason since everything would be downloadable anyway, and since my eeepc worked straight out of the box, i didnt have to do anything
I'm sure you would be able to get the tabbed window manager with the normal ubuntu installation with a bit of hacking
i have a 10" :D
ah ok
I have to admit, the idea is good, execution, not so much
hehe, maybe its something in the tray not starting properly
but its present on all screenshots of karmic UNR i can find, so its definately a bug
well yeah just ignore it till the next release, unless theres a beta out for lucid nbr
oh, whatcha know i was right :P
oh, nevermind xD
xchat-gnome is the same as xchat in the terms of using screen space is it not?
no, it has the hidden userlist which afaik is not in xchat regular
ah okay
